title: Drawing, "Design for a Sepulchral Monument", ca. 1675
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, black chalk on cream laid paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Vertical rectangle. Framed by architectural motifs. Below is a dado with a sarcophagus at center. The bust of a man is obliquely disposed on the top. The celebration of the Mass is shown  as a background, probably intended to be painted. Above is an entablature with an escutcheon and an oculus framed by scrolls.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Sepulchral Monument", ca. 1675.
ca. 1675. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, black chalk on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-2575.
